content.raw:
Hm… Re-reading this section, the wording seems stale now that we have the explicit `__model__` frame. Perhaps we replace “implicit frame” with “the model frame”?

For the paragraph below, can we say something like:

```
The model frame's pose will be defined by the `//model/pose` element for both non-static and static models, unless it is overridden via `//include/pose`.
```

Or something that effect?
content.html:
Hm… Re-reading this section, the wording seems stale now that we have the explicit __model__ frame. Perhaps we replace “implicit frame” with “the model frame”?

For the paragraph below, can we say something like:

The model frame's pose will be defined by the `//model/pose` element for both non-static and static models, unless it is overridden via `//include/pose`.

Or something that effect?
